actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to modify the provisions defining insured status for purposes of disability benefits and the disability freeze in the case of workers who become disabled while young.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual who becomes disabled shall be insured for disability insurance benefits in any month if (1) he would have been insured had he reached age 62 and filed for benefits on the first day of such month, and (2) he has not yet reached age 31 and has performed work covered under the Act for at least one half of the quarters (and not less than six) during the period beginning with the quarter in which he attained age 21 and ending with the quarter in which he files for benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to modify the provisions defining insured status for purposes of disability benefits and the disability freeze in the case of workers who become disabled while young.
